Author: OrionDax

Comment: That’s the million dollar question. How do Democrats dumb down the messaging while still appearing competent?  The big difference between each side of the aisle is the constituency. On the right, they’re looking for something to hate and a way to say they won. If it pisses off the other side they’re good to go. On the left they want something to believe in, somebody to fight for them, AND they want to see results.  The GOP can promise to fuck shit up and deliver with the simple message of, “we will fuck shit up and liberals will be miserable.” No plan needed so no plan offered. All red voters want is an issue they can agree with and everything else can be forgiven.  Democrats want that detailed plan because we keep the receipts. Most Democrats don’t care about single topics with a great deal of them wanting all of their wants met by a candidate with no room for compromise.  It’s like ordering up a pizza for a group of people. One side wants sardines. The other side can’t decide between pepperoni, hamburger, or Canadian bacon and pineapple. While they’re all perfectly fine with pepperoni but they’re tired of just going with the group so they dig in and vote for their rando topping. The other side all votes sardines like they said they would and that’s what arrives. An extra large sardine pizza for everybody to eat because of principles or whatever.
